N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Chapter, unless the context otherwise
requires, the term: (a) Aircraft means
and includes any and all contrivances now or hereafter used for the navigation
of or flight in air or space, including but not limited to airplanes, airships, dirigibles, helicopters, gliders, amphibians and seaplanes. (b) Authority means the Niagara Frontier

Transportation Authority. (c) Authority rules and regulations means and includes the rules and regulations
set forth in this Chapter. (d) Fuel
storage area means and includes those portions of a terminal designated
temporarily or permanently by the authority as areas in which gasoline or any
other type of fuel may be stored, including but not limited to gasoline tank
farms and bulkheads, piers or wharves at which fuel is located. (e) Manager means and includes the authority
manager or other authority official in charge of a terminal, or his duly
authorized representative. (f) Operational area means and includes any place at a terminal not leased to
anyone for exclusive use and not a terminal highway, public vehicular parking
area, public landing area, public ramp and apron area, public passenger ramp
and apron area, public cargo ramp and apron area, public aircraft parking and
storage area or fuel storage area. (g) Permission means authorization granted by
the manager, unless otherwise specifically provided. (h) Person means and includes any individual, firm, copartnership, corporation, association or company (including any
assignee, receiver, trustee or similar representative thereof) or the United

States of America or any foreign government or any state or political
subdivision thereof, or the United Nations. (i) Terminal means and includes: (1)
air terminal developments operated by the
authority consisting of runways, hangars, control towers, roads, ramps, buildings, structures, parking areas, improvements, facilities or other real
property necessary, convenient or desirable for the landing, taking off, accommodation and servicing of aircraft of all types, including but not limited
to airplanes, airships, dirigibles, helicopters, gliders, amphibians, seaplanes
or any other contrivance now or hereafter used for the navigation of or flight
in air or space, operated by carriers engaged in the transportation of
passengers or cargo, or for the loading, unloading, interchange or transfer of
such passengers or their baggage, or such cargo or otherwise for the
accommodation, use or convenience of such passengers, or such carriers or their
employees, or for the landing, taking off, accommodation and servicing of
aircraft owned or operated by persons other than carriers; (2)
marine terminal developments operated by
the authority consisting of unimproved lands, one or more piers, harbors, wharves, docks, bulkheads, slips, basins, roads, railway connections, sidetracks, sidings or other buildings, structures, facilities or improvements, necessary or convenient to the accommodation of steamships, small boats or
other vessels and their cargoes or passengers; (3)
bus terminal or transportation center
developments operated by the authority, consisting of buildings, roads, ramps, structures, parking areas, improvements, elevators, escalators, sidewalks or
other real or personal property or facilities necessary, convenient or
desirable for the accommodation and servicing of all types of transportation
conveyances, including but not limited to buses, transports, or any other
contrivance now operated by carriers engaged in the transportation of
passengers or cargo, or for the loading, unloading, interchange or transfer of
such passengers or their baggage, or such cargo, or otherwise for the
accommodation, use or convenience of such passengers, or such carriers or their
employees, or for the boarding or discharge of such passengers or cargo, or for
the accommodation and servicing of any and every means of public or private
conveyance owned or operated by persons other than carriers. (j) Terminal highway means and
includes those portions or areas of an air terminal, marine terminal, bus
terminal or transportation center designated and made available temporarily or
permanently to the public for general or limited highway use. (k) Traffic means and includes pedestrians, animals and vehicles. (l) Vehicle
means and includes automobiles, trucks, buses, motorcycles, horsedrawn
vehicles, bicycles, pushcarts and any other device in or upon or by which any
person or property is or may be transported, carried or drawn upon land, except
railroad rolling equipment or other devices running only on stationary rails or
tracks, and except aircraft. (m) Watercraft means and includes any and all contrivances now or hereafter used
for the navigation of waterways, including but not limited to any ship, steamship, lighter, carfloat, scow, yacht, motorboat, sailboat or other similar
watercraft or equipment, whether used for private or commercial
purposes. (n) Landing area shall
mean and include those portions of an air terminal including runways and
taxiways designated and made available temporarily or permanently by the
authority for the landing and taking off of aircraft, and other areas between
and adjacent to said runways and taxiways. Notes
